summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Michael Reiter, commanding his appearance and production of documents related to the criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and his associates from approximately 2005 to 2007. The subpoena is accompanied by a cover letter requesting confidentiality and an Advice of Rights form.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Michael Reiter
persons.context: Commanded to appear before the grand jury and produce documents relating to the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The criminal investigation referenced in the subpoena is focused on him and his associates.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a legal command (subpoena) to Reiter to testify and produce documents.
Reiter is being subpoenaed to provide evidence and documents related to the criminal investigation of Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Michael Reiter is commanded to appear before the federal grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Michael Reiter in connection with the Epstein investigation.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Michael Reiter on October 16, 2019, commanding his appearance on October 31, 2019.
The subpoena demands production of all documents relating to the criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and his associates from approximately 2005 to 2007.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document includes an 'Advice of Rights' form informing the recipient of their right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
